result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Archie J Saros

records.addlTxt: 01:58 PM Defendant Archie J Saros in court with attorney Breanna A. Halyburton.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 21CM158 and 22CM01. Attorney Halyburton appears via Zoom video. Court asks Saros why he did not appear this morning when scheduled. Saros respond, overslept. Court has issued a warrant for his arrest and forfeited bond posted. Halyburton makes statement, defendant contacted her office about 1.5 hours after his scheduled court time, asking Court to vacate both warrant, reinstate both bonds with same conditions. Court will first do AIA. Saros and Halyburton have both complaints, waives reading of them, enters NG pleas to all counts, set for FP. Court will accept plea, will quash both warrants and will reinstate both of the previoulsy set bonds, set both matters for JT, keep in contact with attorney.

10:19 AM Attorney Breanna A. Halyburton in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court calls 22CM01 and 21M158. Halyburton thought that her client was going to appear via Zoom. Clerk confirms that he is not in the waiting room. State - 21CM158 - asks for forfeiture of bond posted and bench warrant, body or $300.00; on 22CM01 - asks for forfeiture of any bond posted, bench warrant body or $300.00. Court so orders.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Adjourned initial appearance on March 23, 2022 at 10:15 am.

09:49 AM Defendant Archie J Saros in court.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Archie J Saros appeared by video means. Court calls 21CM158 a nd 22CM01. Court asks Saros if he has talked to SPD. Saros responds, thinks he talked to somebody. Court upset, has been told several times to contact SPD, will need to appear in person in the future, reminds him of the advantages of having an attorney. Saros understands, states he has gotten a hold of someone and they are not here today (thinks the attorney's names is Robert, not sure of the last name). Saros states that he did also contact SPD, after instructed to be the Court, states they found him eligible, don't have anyone for him. Court will allow one more adjournment, will be contacting SPD to see if he really did contact them and consequences if he did not, continues bond on both cases, sets for AIA on both cases on 3/23/22 at 10:15 AM, gives ramifications of appearing without an attorney again. Clerk confirms address and phone number.
Adjourned initial appearance on February 16, 2022 at 09:45 am.

09:57 AM Defendant Archie J Saros in court, in custody and appears from FOSO.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Archie J Saros appeared by video means. All other parties appear in person. Court calls 21CM158 and 22CM01. Court has previousy been informed of the charges and penalties, asks if he has contacted SPD. Saros responds, did talk to someone but states he has not talked to anyone from SPD. Court instructs to keep in constant contact with them, continues bond both cases, sets both matters for AIA on 2/16/22 at 9:45 AM.
Adjourned initial appearance on January 12, 2022 at 09:45 am.

ADDRESS INFO for Archie J Saros
Current: 363rd Lane, McGregor, MN 55760 United States  (Effective: 01-04-2022)
Prior: 304 W Glen Street #28, Crandon, WI 54520
Absolute sobriety. No entry into any bars or taverns.

09:57 AM Defendant Archie J Saros appears by video from FC jail, in custody.  Alexander Paul Seifert appeared for the State of Wisconsin appears by video through zoom. CC and CR appear by video through zoom. Called 21CM158. Saros has received copy of complaint. Court reads charges and penalties. Court questions if he has contacted an attorney. Saros indicates he has tried to contact SPD - line always busy. Court advises of options of obtaining an attorney, SPD, private hire and court appointed. Court instructs to continue to contact SPD to see if he is eligible for attorney. Bond is currently set at $500 cash bond. Seifert indicates there is a second case, just filed this morning, 22CM01. Court now calls 22CM01, 10:03 AM. Saros does not have a copy of that complaint. State will have a copy of complaint sent to the FC jail. Court reads charges and penalties. Saros understands. Court questions if he is sitting on anything other this bond. Saros responds - unsure may have a bond in MN. State asks for $200 cash bond on each case. Court will reduces bond on 21CM15 to $200 cash, absolute sobriety and no entry into any bars or taverns. Court also sets bond at $200 cash in 22CM01 with the same conditions. AIA set for both cases on 1/12/22 at 9:45 AM Saros questions bond. Court clarifies he must post $200 on each case in order to be released. Saros understands.
